de.btu.openinfra.backend.db.daos

Class ProjectDao

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.btu.openinfra.backend.db.daos.OpenInfraDao<ProjectPojo,Project>
      • de.btu.openinfra.backend.db.daos.ProjectDao

  • public class ProjectDao
extends OpenInfraDao<ProjectPojo,Project>
    This class represents the Project and is used to access the underlying layer generated by JPA.
    Author:
    BTU DBIS

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProjectDao

        public ProjectDao(UUID currentProjectId,
          OpenInfraSchemas schema)
        This is the required constructor which calls the super constructor and in turn creates the corresponding entity manager.
        Parameters:
        currentProjectId - the current project id (this should be null when the system schema is selected)
        schema - the required schema

    • Method Detail

      • readSubProjects

        public List<ProjectPojo> readSubProjects(Locale locale,
                                int offset,
                                int size)
        This method delivers a list of sub projects specified by the current project id OpenInfraDao in only one hierarchy level.
        Parameters:
        locales - A list of Java.util locale objects. All locals which this list contains will be returned. As defined by rfc2616, the asterisk is used to retrieve all available languages.
        offset - the number where to start
        size - the size of items to provide
        Returns:
        a list of sub projects referring to the specified project in only one hierarchy level

      • getSubProjectsCount

        public long getSubProjectsCount()
        This method returns the count of sub projects.
        Returns:
        count of sub projects

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        Description copied from class: OpenInfraDao
        This method retrieves the count of objects and uses a named query. If the query doesn't exists, it will throw an exception.
        Overrides:
        getCount in class OpenInfraDao<ProjectPojo,Project>
        Returns:
        count of objects or zero

      • readMainProjects

        public List<ProjectPojo> readMainProjects(Locale locale)
        This method delivers a list of main projects retrieved from metadata database. This method also retrieves the name and description of all main projects specified by the locale parameter.
        Parameters:
        locale - the required language
        Returns:
        a list of main projects

      • getMainProjectsCount

        public long getMainProjectsCount()
        This method returns the count of main projects.
        Returns:
        the count of main projects

      • mapToPojo

        public ProjectPojo mapToPojo(Locale locale,
                    Project p)
        Description copied from class: OpenInfraDao
        This is an abstract method which must be implemented by deriving classes. It should map a JPA model object into corresponding a POJO object. This method is really slow. Thus, don't use this method too often. It's recommended to provide another static method which should be much faster.
        Specified by:
        mapToPojo in class OpenInfraDao<ProjectPojo,Project>
        p - the JPA model object
        Returns:
        a corresponding POJO object

      • mapToModel

        public MappingResult<Project> mapToModel(ProjectPojo pojo,
                                Project p)
        Description copied from class: OpenInfraDao
        This is an abstract method which must be implemented by deriving classes. It should map a POJO object into a corresponding JPA model object.
        Specified by:
        mapToModel in class OpenInfraDao<ProjectPojo,Project>
        Parameters:
        pojo - the POJO object
        p - the pre initialized model object
        Returns:
        a corresponding JPA model object

      • readParents

        public List<ProjectPojo> readParents(Locale locale)
        This method delivers a list of parents in reverse order.
        Parameters:
        locale - the required locale
        Returns:
        a list of parents in reverse order

      • getParents

        public static List<ProjectPojo> getParents(Locale locale,
                           String url)
        This is a special method which returns a hierarchical list of parent projects plus the current project.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale of the request (shouldn't be null)
        url - the current URL
        Returns:
        list of parents or a list containing a null value

      • getCurrentProject

        public static String getCurrentProject(String url)
        This is a static method which returns the current project id by the given URL string. It'll return an empty String object when the current URL doesn't contain a specific project id.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to parse
        Returns:
        the current project id or null when not specified

      • createProject

        public UUID createProject(ProjectPojo pojo,
                 boolean createEmpty,
                 boolean loadInitialData)
        This method decides if the project that should be created is a new sub project or a new main project. If it is a new main project it is necessary to create a new database schema and write some data into the meta data schema.
        Parameters:
        project - the project pojo
        createEmpty - Creates an empty project schema when true.
        loadInitialData - Loads the initial data from the system schema when true. This parameter will only have an effect if createEmpty is false.
        Returns:
        the UUID of the new created project
        Throws:
        OpenInfraWebException - if something went wrong

      • deleteProject

        public boolean deleteProject()
        This method decides if the project that should be deleted is a sub project or a main project. If it is a main project it is necessary to delete the database schema and remove the project entry in the meta data schema.
        Returns:
        true if the project was deleted
        Throws:
        OpenInfraWebException
